intro: Omphalea trichotoma, commonly known as the white spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences called cyathia, which are surrounded by leaf-like bracts. Omphalea trichotoma is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open fields.
